    Farrusco Road Trip

    14 March 2011

    Now that you've met Farrusco, we can explain you some of the work we developed till we get the final version, available in guibot.pt.

    In one of it initial iterations, Farrusco had a camera on it and was controlled remotely via xbee. It was developed by Guilherme Martins in a project called SWARS (See What A Robot Sees).

    Guilherme purposed to Nuno Morgadinho and Ana Aires (widgilabs) to develop a remote control via web application during the AZResidency, an artistic residency promoted by Rui Horta that took place in the beautiful Convento da Saudação in Montemor-o-Novo.

    Do you wanna see how it worked out? Did Farrusco missed home? Read all the report by Nuno Morgadinho here.

    Farrusco's coming back home soon and we hope that you will be able to gain control over him, remotely of course!

    Read the full post

    09 March 2011
